title.narrative: STRENGTHENING EVIDENCE BASED POLICIES

description.narrative: National capacities are strengthened for developing evidence-based policies and for effectively monitoring their implementation., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Data And Child Protection, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, innovative partnerships and child rights platforms enable the increased commitment, cooperation and contribution of various stakeholders to the protection and realization of child rights in Croatia and beyond its borders.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National capacities are strengthened for developing evidence-based policies and for effectively monitoring their implementation.

description.narrative: UNICEF generated and utilized a substantive set of data, information and insights to inform and guide future programming as well as to increase national capacities (including media) for child rights monitoring and evidence-based policies. Particular focus was on children's and adolescents' wellbeing and meaningful participation. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/08/2020

title.narrative: Number of journalists who gained additional knowledge on selected equity issues and the situation of the most vulnerable children

Extent to which UNICEF engagement with key data providers has contributed to increase their capacities for collecting and analysing quality and reliable dissagregated data on children, with specific focus on vulnerable groups of children (scale 1 to 4, 1-to a small extent, 2-to a moderate extent, 3-to a large extent, 4-to a very large extent)

actual.value: 2020:2.5 (National child protection indicators have been reviewed in line with the regional guidance; the Ministry is engaged in their further adjustments to better meet the monitoring needs).

title.narrative: Availability of high quality, participatory, child oriented and gender sensitive methodology for assessing the situation of child rights at local level

actual.value: 2020:Detailed Programme Document with Work Plan and Budget has been developed in cooperation with the partner - CSO managing the CFCI in Croatia

title.narrative: Availability of platform for promoting children's participation

actual.value: 2020:The Platform has been functional; CPAB Work Plan is being implemented

title.narrative: Availability of comprehensive Situation Analysis Report

actual.value: 2020:The multi-sectoral SitAn Reference group is established and functional, preliminary report timely submitted based on conducted desk review analysis.
